DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Intraocular Pressures ( IOP ) During Prolonged Trendelenburg Positioning Morbidly Obese Thin Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Eye pressure measure protocol specify interval .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subjects undergo prolonged procedure ( schedule > 3hr ) steep Trendelenburg position ( eg . robotic prostatectomy , hysterectomy , cystectomy ) 2 . Morbidly obese subject : BMI ≥ 35 kg/m2 3 . Thin subject : BMI ≤ 30 kg/m2 4 . Age 1870 5 . ASA ( American Society Anesthesiologists ) physical status classification I , II , III 1 . Known history glaucoma 2 . Note : initial IOP note > 21mmHg ( millimeter mercury ) , patient exclude study ophthalmology consultation obtained.Surgery postpone . 3 . Recent use IOP lower topical ophthalmic agent 4 . Allergy latex proparacaine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution 5 . Patients active corneal epithelial defect history recurrent corneal erosion 6 . Patients underlie disorder directly increase intraocular pressure ( thyroid eye disease , intra orbital tumor , orbital vascular malformation , SturgeWeber disease , carotid dural cavernous arteriovenous malformation , cavernous sinus pathology ) 7 . History corneal surgery , include LASIK ( laserassisted insitu keratomileusis ) 8 . Any eye surgery within prior 1 month 9 . Known pregnancy 10 . Cognitive impairment
